intro: Haplostephium pinnifolium, commonly known as the slender strobilanthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, pinnately divided leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
